posts.post_content:
One of my all time favorite cards [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) just become irrelevant. Seriously, this at 3WW is absurd. I'm not going to say they killed Magic 2010 by printing this, but they sure crippled it.. In limited this dominates battlefield and in constructed it's still awesome. In legacy it rocks and in vintage it's just ok. At least they didn't add protection from black and red. 5/5 normally, but 4/5 from a vintage player's standpoint.
  
Casual play is just as frustrating for some if they keep printing stuff like this.
posts.html:

Posted By: Kartakass (9/20/2009 10:42:34 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Completely broken, absurd card. Anything SPLASHING white will run 3 or even a playset. It's the default five drop. It adds NOTHING to the game, it doesnt have interaction, drawbacks, it's not a situational card or anything, well done Hasbro, keep ruining Magic. This is why i dont play it anymore outside of MWS, standard decks run 4x of this 40$ crap and extended decks with creatures MUST run a playset of expensivegoyfs if they dont want to lose. If tarmogoyf is what we see on 'Futuresight' as rare, hell, i can't even imagine what kind of unbalanced crap will wizards come up with for the 'mythic rare' slot in few years.

Posted By: Kryptnyt (1/13/2010 7:00:25 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Ridiculous. It's either slightly undercosted or has one (or two) too many abilities. I always thought [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) was balanced, but powerful. [Shepherd of the Lost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shepherd of the Lost) is a balanced angel as well for the same converted mana cost. But this ? It should've had less power and toughness (say, 3 each), be legendary or cost more, in my opinion. Rarity should have nothing to do with a card's actual power, but instead provide possibilities not present on the more common cards.
posts.html:
Ridiculous. It's either slightly undercosted or has one (or two) too many abilities. I always thought Serra Angel was balanced, but powerful. posts.post_content:
as NecroArTeest said
  
 "*baneslayer's lifelink, first strike and +1/+1 (not to mention pro demons/dragons) > serra's vigilance.
  
   
both die to removal. (removal excuse is invalid)
  
   
what is serra's advantage giving that it has the same cost as baneslayer?
  
   
it has none.
  
   
realistically serra = virtually useless.
  
   
baneslayer will replace it nine times out of ten.
  
   
aka power creep.* "
  
I'm pretty sure liflink itself = vigilince because unless you're going to chump block you should have the same board position from it (attack = 4 (5 but this is ignoring the +1/+1 in order to look at the ability matchup) damage to opponent, +4 life, taken later as damage when opponent attacks, no creature loss... vs. attack for 4 damage, then block opponent and trade, both lose a creature and your net life is still the same) then you get bonus +1/+1, first strike, and pro demons/dragons just cuz
  
   
I think I'd hate this card less if Serra Angel wasn't in the set... but why wotc, why destroy a c... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: MizoreIceQueen (1/17/2010 12:18:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I just pulled one of these from a pack last night and was very happy. This is definitely an excellent card. I rate it a 4.5, but I also don't see why this card is demanding such a high price. It's not a game breaker and it's not exactly hard to get rid of. It's just an excellent creature and nothing more. I also don't think it's necessarily better than a Serra Angel. It's very situational and vigilance is such a great ability to have, especially in multi-player games. In any case, I won't complain at all about such a great card.
posts.html:

Posted By: kowrip (1/15/2010 9:43:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card epitomizes everything I hate about modern Magic. Totally over powered / under coasted. Nothing fun about this card at all, Simply put this card reads "unless you have X4 of this card as well you will probably not beat me" cards like this ruin the game, they take away the strategy / skill and creativity and create a situation where there is just one best deck, which every one has. I love Magic the Gathering but the more I see this kind of insane card in newer sets the less inclined I am to buy newer sets and less likely I am to play new opponents as my not playing this doesn’t stop others from doing so.  
Shame on you Wizards for deciding that Mythic Rare should = overpowered and un-fun.
posts.html:
